body_content.explanation: to colonize a country (= send people to live in and govern it) again, for a second, third, etc. time:
examples: He believes it is part of a Western conspiracy to recolonize India and Africa.
This effort to re-colonize an already thriving civilization was largely successful.

body_content.explanation: (of animals, plants, or organisms) to start to live or grow again in a particular area, or to encourage animals, etc. to live or grow somewhere:
examples: The frogs are beginning to recolonize their former habitat.
Certain rare plants would probably be present in other areas and a number of them will recolonize over time.
It may be possible to recolonize the gut with what are called "friendly" bacteria, available in the form of "probiotics" such as Lactobacillus acidophilus.
